nodes.bodyText: I think Long.valueOf is preferred over new Long. It has the benefit of returning a cached instance of Longs in the range of -128..127 which is probably what we have most of the time in this code.
yea, this is just a relic of me trying to debug stuff and trying dumb ideas...i removed the boxing.
The old code that returned "long" was okay wasn't it? Any reason to change this to Long?
remove these blank lines if they are not needed

+public class SingleResultCollector<T> implements ResultCollector<T, T> {
+  T result;

nodes.bodyText: Should this check to see if result != null and throw an IllegalStateException? If someone accidently uses this and gives it multiple results it seems like an exception would be more helpful than just having the last one win
yea, that feels much safer.  done
remove the javadocs on this method that talk about "the result of..."
